fgeo.map 0.0.0.9204
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Label the four divisions of a quadrat -- each with four subquadrats.

Source: R/maply_tag.R
paginate.Rd

This function makes it possible for maply_tag() to plot each individual map. Each map corresponds to one page and includes four subquadrats. There are a total of four maps per quadrat (i.e. a total of 16 subquadrats per quadrat).

paginate(x, bl = 1, br = 2, tr = 3, tl = 4,
  subquad_offset = NULL)

Arguments

x

A dataframe with the variable subquadrat.
bl, br, tr, tl

Number or character giving the label of the four subquadrats on each or the four divisions of a quadrat: bottom left (bl), bottom right (br), top right (tr), and top left (tl).
subquad_offset

NULL or -1. This argument is for internal use. It helps paginate to use the same code for data with two different types of labels for the subquadrat variable: (1) that with subquadrat-columns starting at 1; and (2) that with subquadrat-columns starting at 0.

The four divisions of a quadrat (bl, br, tr, tl), each with four subquadrats:

tl       tr
----     -----
14 24    34 44
13 23    33 43

bl       br
----     -----
12 22    32 42
11 21    31 41

Value

A modified version of the input with the additional variable page.

See also

fgeo.tool::add_subquad().

Examples

# NOT RUN {
library(dplyr)
viewfulltable <- tribble(
   ~QX,  ~QY,
  17.9,    0,
   4.1,   15,
   6.1, 17.3
)
with_subquad <- fgeo.tool::add_subquad(viewfulltable, 20, 20, 5, 5)

# Warning: Internal function
fgeo.map:::paginate(with_subquad)
fgeo.map:::paginate(with_subquad, "a", "b", "c", "d")
# }
